headline.main: U.S. STRATEGY SCORED BY JAPANESE GENERAL; Officers Deficient and People Too Serious, He Says

lead_paragraph: Major Gen. Kenryo Sato, director of the Military Affairs Board of the Japanese War Ministry, told a committee meeting of the Diet yesterday that United States Military strategy was bad, that United States officers had "an extreme deficiency" and that, besides, the American people were too "serious," the Tokyo radio reported, according to the Office of War Information.
abstract: S on US mil strategy and officers, Diet com
